data.name: User Database â€” Create, Evolve, and Clear Users with Filters (Predicates)
data.description:
In this Kata, you will learn how to set a new user into a Database, then evolving and clearing with given Predicates required to do so.

First off, you will create a Database, either with `class Database {}` or the pre-given `function Database() {}`; Whichever one you feel most comfortable with.

It should hold a property called `users`, which will be an instance of `Map`

A `create(id)` method should push a user into the Map with the given ID. If there is no given ID, it should be the user size + 1

* If the given ID already exists in the Database, it should throw a new `Error` instance, of any kind.
* When called on, a new user should hold properties `age`, `veteran`. Respectively, their default values should be `0` and `false`.

An `evolve(fn)` method, when called, users in the `Map` should be checked to see if they meet the filter predicate given.

* If they pass, their age should be incremented by 1.
* When they evolve, if their age is at least `10`, their own Veteran status should become `true`.
* Any time the `fn` argument is not passed, its default should evolve all.

Finally, there should be a `clear(fn)` method. All users that pass the given filter should be deleted from the database.

* If they pass, they should be deleted from the database.
* Any time the `fn` argument is not passed, its default should delete all.

Predicate Arguments:
* `info` - The user's value in `users`.
  * Example: `{ age: 9, veteran: false }`
* `id` - The user's ID in `users`.
  * Example: `2`
* `index` - The zero-based index of the current iteration.
  * Example: `1`

**Extra Information**
  * `create(id)` - The input will always be a string
  * `evolve(fn)` & `clear(fn)` - The input will always be a function
